intro: Setilobus neves-armondii, commonly known as the Neves Armondii plant, is a rare flowering species native to specific regions of Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its distinctive palmate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in tropical climates with high humidity and well-drained soil. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
